sentences.sContent: Knowledge in the field of genetics has been developing very rapidly.
sentences.sCn: 遗传学领域的知识发展非常迅速。

sentences.sContent: Corsica has developed its economy around the tourist industry.
sentences.sCn: 科西嘉岛的经济是围绕旅游业发展起来的。

sentences.sContent: He had developed a certain affection for me.
sentences.sCn: 他对我产生了一些好感。

sentences.sContent: The land was developed for low-cost housing.
sentences.sCn: 这块土地被开发建造廉价住宅。

sentences.sContent: ...Avoiding conflicts may have helped dogs develop better bonds with humans...
...Fantasy proneness will not necessarily cause people to develop HSAM...
...people take aging research as just an interest area where they can try to develop interventions...
...he said that describing aging as a disease creates incentives to develop treatments...
...a real innovative company should develop an innovation culture and use it as a primary tool for success...
...ff they don't develop an interest of reading during this critical period...
...I fell into conversation with a woman who had helped develop Montessori Letter Sounds...
...but children can develop loss of vision if they have glasses inappropriate for their eyes...
...Boys at single-sex schools were said to be more likely to get involved in cultural and artistic activities that helped develop their emotional expressiveness...

synos.tran: 开发；进步；使成长；使显影

phrases.pContent: torch program（a plan to develop new and high technology）
phrases.pCn: 火炬计划（开发高新科技的一项计划）

words.tran: 发达的（国家或地区）；成熟的
发展；开发；发育；住宅小区（专指由同一开发商开发的）；[摄] 显影

trans.tranOther: to gradually grow or become bigger, more advanced, stronger, etc.; to make sth do this
